**Radar Speed Measuring Equipment - Request for Standing Offer**
=====================================

**Government of Canada**
------------------------

Procurement Bulletin No. [Insert Number]
-----------------------------------------

### Important

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police, Supply Office, currently invites proponents to participate in a Request for Standing Offer (RFSA) for Radar Speed Measuring Equipment.

### Contract Details

*   **Contract Type:** Standing Offer
*   **Contract Duration:** One (1) year term with three (3) additional one (1) year options
*   **Contract Location:** Canada
*   **Procurement Category:** Goods and Services

### Scope of Requirements

We are seeking a single (1) contract for the purchase and delivery of radar speed measuring equipment, in accordance with the requirements outlined in the attached tender documents.

### Evaluation Criteria

To be considered for award, tenderers must meet the evaluation criteria outlined in the tender documents. The basis of selection will be the lowest compliant bid.

### Instructions to Tenderers

*   **Tender Submission:** Tenderers must submit their bids electronically, using the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) system, through the CanadaBuys website.
*   **Language of Submission:** Tenderers may submit their bids in either official language of Canada.
*   **Copy of Tender:** A soft copy of the tender document is available for download from the Tender Opportunities page.
*   **Late Submissions:** Bids must be received by the specified deadline. Late or incomplete submissions will not be accepted.

### Contracting Authority

Contact information for the Contracting Authority is as follows:

*   Daniel Caughey, Contract Officer, Contract Management Section,  
    Royal Canadian Mounted Police  
    73 Leikin Dr, MS 15  
    Ottawa ON, K1A 0R2  
    Tel: 343-550-0936  
    Email: [Daniel.caughey@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:Daniel.caughey@rcmp-grc.gc.ca)

### Conditions of Tender

By responding to this Request for Standing Offer, Tenderers acknowledge having read and understood the terms and conditions outlined in these tender documents. 

### Communication

All correspondence with Crown Purchasing Agent conflict of Interest assessments must be submitted via GETS (System of Award Management)

Canada is not responsible for content found on third-party websites.
